entries.title: Andrew 'Freddie' Flintoff hurt in Top Gear accident
entries.description: The BBC TV show co-host needed hospital treatment while filming at an aerodrome.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: 'Incredible Lionel Messi just makes things happen' - Pablo Zabaleta
entries.description: Former Argentina international Pablo Zabaleta calls Lionel Messi "incredible" as he wins his fourth player of the match award of the World Cup after inspiring his team to the final with a goal and assist during their 3-0 win over Croatia.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Argentina's 'young diamond' Julian Alvarez sparkles in semi-final win
entries.description: Argentina's "young diamond" Julian Alvarez sparkles in their 3-0 semi-final win over Croatia, the Man City striker scored twice and won a penalty to help his country secure a place in Sunday's World Cup final.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Lionel Messi called best player ever as pundits react to Argentine's masterclass
entries.description: Lionel Messi was dubbed the greatest player of all time as he led Argentina into the World Cup final - and one last chance to win the most famous trophy of all.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: 'Qatar 2022 on the brink of becoming Lionel Messi's World Cup'
entries.description: Argentina winning the World Cup will see Qatar 2022 become known as Lionel Messi's World Cup, says BBC Sport's Phil McNulty.

entries.title: Prince William and Kate release family Christmas card image
entries.description: The photograph shows the family of five dressed casually, smiling and holding hands in Norfolk.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Lionel Messi voted your star player in semi-final win
entries.description: Lionel Messi was voted player of the match as he led his side to the World Cup final with victory over Croatia in Qatar.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Lionel Messi brilliantly sets up Julian Alvarez for Argentina's third
entries.description: Lionel Messi brilliantly sets up Julian Alvarez for Argentina's third goal against Croatia.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Lionel Messi and Julian Alvarez shine as Argentina reach final
entries.description: Lionel Messi and Julian Alvarez shine for Argentina as they beat Croatia 3-0 to reach the World Cup final.

entries.title: Belgium search for 'serial winner' as head coach job advertised
entries.description: Belgium Football Association advertise for a new manager following their early World Cup exit.

entries.title: Avatar: The Way of Water reviews vary wildly between critics
entries.description: The Way of Water is the follow-up to 2009's Avatar, the highest-grossing movie of all time.

entries.title: Nice: Eight guilty over the deadly Bastille Day lorry attack
entries.description: They are given jail terms from two to 18 years over the 2016 lorry attack that left 86 people dead.

entries.title: Who is striking tomorrow? How walkouts on Wednesday 14 December will affect you
entries.description: Rail disruption and another Royal Mail walkout - what you need to know by the BBC’s Zoe Conway.

entries.title: Spy chiefs warned about tweets and TV appearances
entries.description: The head of MI6 tweets far more than any other head past or present, MPs say.

entries.title: Elon Musk no longer world's richest man
entries.description: His wealth has been hit as shares in his electric car maker Tesla have more than halved.

entries.title: Randolph Ross: USA sprinter banned until 2025 over faked email
entries.description: Randolph Ross, part of the United States' gold-winning 4x400m squad at the Tokyo Olympics, is banned for three years for faking an email to doping officials.

entries.title: What is nuclear fusion and how does it work?
entries.description: Could nuclear fusion really provide the world with almost limitless supplies of energy?

entries.title: Reality TV star Stephen Bear guilty of sex tape offences
entries.description: Reality TV's Stephen Bear is found guilty of voyeurism and disclosing private, sexual photos and films.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Antoine Griezmann - an underrated France legend?
entries.description: Three months ago, France's Antoine Griezmann was a substitute amid a contract farce - now there is no stopping him in his second great World Cup.

entries.title: Charities dismay as Twitter disbands safety group
entries.description: The Trust and Safety Council advised on how Twitter tackled hate speech, child abuse and self-harm.

entries.title: Warren Gatland: Returning head coach believes he can get Wales winning again
entries.description: Warren Gatland believes he can turn around Welsh rugby's fortunes once again after returning to the top job.

entries.title: Millions face £250 monthly mortgage rise next year
entries.description: The average monthly mortgage bill will go up from £750 to £1,000, the Bank of England says.

entries.title: US scientists announce fusion energy breakthrough
entries.description: Researchers have overcome a major barrier to achieving low-carbon nuclear fusion.

entries.title: Azeem Rafiq "driven out of country" since speaking out on racism
entries.description: Azeem Rafiq says he has "been driven out of the country" by "threats and abuse" since "opening his heart out" about racism at Yorkshire.

entries.title: Cancer mRNA vaccine completes pivotal trial
entries.description: It uses the same messenger-RNA technology as some Covid-19 vaccines.

entries.title: Police search for human remains in Birmingham after child death report
entries.description: It follows information given to police regarding a death at a house in Birmingham in 2020.

entries.title: Netball Australia to change to new 'inclusive' uniform in 2023
entries.description: Netball Australia will allow players to choose their own uniform to try and make the sport more inclusive.

entries.title: Welsh midwives vote to strike, but England turnout too low
entries.description: The strike vote didn't make the 50% legal threshold for turnout in England.

entries.title: 'Last Hawaiian princess' Abigail Kawānanakoa dies with $215m in wealth
entries.description: Abigail Kinoiki Kekaulike Kawānanakoa's ancestors include Hawaiian royalty and an Irish landowner.

entries.title: Sunak promises end to asylum seeker backlog
entries.description: The UK aims to end the backlog of asylum seekers by end of next year with new staff, Rishi Sunak says.

entries.title: The Argentine pop song that's Messi's anthem
entries.description: An Argentine pop song has become the unofficial World Cup anthem for Lionel Messi, the Argentina squad and fans.

entries.title: Woman jailed for murder of two-year-old son
entries.description: The 42-year-old was handed a 20-year sentence for the murder and attempted murder of her two sons.

entries.title: Two more deaths confirmed in Jersey explosion
entries.description: Police say there are now seven confirmed deaths from the blast in St Helier on Saturday.

entries.title: BBL: Sydney Thunder beat Melbourne Stars in thrilling last-ball finish in Big Bash opener
entries.description: Sydney Thunder beat Melbourne Stars by one wicket in a thrilling last-ball finish to a low-scoring Big Bash League opener.

entries.title: Conservative MP Adam Afriyie declared bankrupt
entries.description: A court heard Mr Afriyie, who represents Windsor, owed around £1m to HMRC and £700,000 to Barclays bank.

entries.title: Emma Caldwell accused faces charges against 28 women
entries.description: Iain Packer has pleaded not guilty to a total of 46 charges, including 11 rapes, over a 26-year period.

entries.title: Bournemouth: Bill Foley-led partnership completes takeover of club
entries.description: A partnership led by American businessman Bill Foley has completed its takeover of Bournemouth.

entries.title: Lionel Messi: Watch all of his World Cup goals
entries.description: Watch all of Lionel Messi's World Cup goals so far as he prepares to lead Argentina against Croatia in the semi-finals at Qatar 2022.

entries.title: US charges Sam Bankman-Fried with defrauding investors
entries.description: He is accused of "orchestrating a scheme" to defraud investors in failed crypto exchange FTX.

entries.title: Mick Lynch: RMT leader hits out at BBC train strikes coverage
entries.description: The boss of the UK's biggest rail union accuses the BBC of "parroting" the right-wing press.

entries.title: UK weather: Drivers warned as snow and ice alerts continue
entries.description: The cold snap continues and snow turns to ice in many places across the UK.

entries.title: Gene-edited hens may stop billions of chicks being culled
entries.description: Israeli researchers claim to have developed a flock of gene-edited hens that lay eggs from which only female chicks hatch.

entries.title: Vigil held for three boys who died in icy lake near Solihull
entries.description: The community near Solihull is "in an utter state of shock" after the deaths.

entries.title: Morocco eye upset ahead of France game
entries.description: Manager Walid Regragui says Morocco have "great desire" to pull off another shock as they aim to create more history and reach a World Cup final.

entries.title: EU corruption scandal: MEP denies Qatar bribery after over €1m seized
entries.description: Eva Kaili, one of four suspects, is stripped of her role as vice president of the European Parliament.

entries.title: Taylor Swift: Judge dismisses Shake It Off copyright lawsuit
entries.description: Two songwriters had alleged that the singer lifted their lyrics for her hit song Shake It Off.

entries.title: Dangerous Christmas lights listed for sale on Amazon and eBay, Which? finds
entries.description: Testing by consumer group Which? finds some cheap lights fail to meet UK electrical safety regulations.

entries.title: Tony Hudgell: Family appalled at Gatwick wheelchair wait
entries.description: The airport apologised after double-amputee Tony Hudgell was forced to wait four-and-a-half hours.

entries.title: Gareth Southgate: Your messages to England manager as he considers future
entries.description: What do BBC Sport users want to say to "conflicted" England manager Gareth Southgate as he considers his future?

entries.title: Anger as Roma teen shot by Greek police dies
entries.description: The 16-year-old was shot in the head in the city of Thessaloniki after allegedly stealing €20 of petrol.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Hugo Lloris texted Harry Kane after France beat England
entries.description: France captain Hugo Lloris says "it was not easy to find the words" when he texted Tottenham team-mate Harry Kane after England's World Cup exit.

entries.title: Lockerbie: An atrocity that caused heartbreak around the world
entries.description: BBC Scotland's David Cowan recalls the trial 22 years ago of two men accused of the Lockerbie bombing.

entries.title: NZ PM Ardern apologises for MP insult caught on mic
entries.description: In a parliamentary debate, the New Zealand prime minister used the insult after sitting down.

entries.title: Diver finds jewellery worth £10k in Helford river
entries.description: Police hope the distinctive haul of rings and pendants can be reunited with their owner.

entries.title: Pakistan v England: Special tour makes it feel like cricket has come home - Aatif Nawaz
entries.description: Test Match Special commentator and comedian Aatif Nawaz reflects on the importance of England's historic tour to Pakistan.

entries.title: Eddie Jones to return to Twickenham with Barbarians
entries.description: Former England coach Eddie Jones will return to Twickenham on 28 May to lead the Barbarians in a match against a World XV.

entries.title: Spotlight: Paramilitary loan sharks targeting food bank users
entries.description: Victims of illegal money lenders tell BBC Spotlight how they faced a cycle of debt and intimidation.

entries.title: Conor Benn positive drug tests: Fighter says 'truth will soon come out'
entries.description: Britain's Conor Benn says "the truth will soon come out" following his positive tests for a banned substance.

entries.title: Ferrari: Frederic Vasseur, ex-Alfa Romeo boss, is new team principal
entries.description: Ferrari name former Alfa Romeo boss Frederic Vasseur as their team principal following Mattia Binotto's departure.

entries.title: Pakistan v England: Rawalpindi pitch for first Test rated 'below average'
entries.description: The Rawalpindi pitch on which England won a thrilling first Test against Pakistan is rated as 'below average' by the match referee.

entries.title: Highest number of days lost to strikes in over 10 years
entries.description: Some 417,000 working days were lost to industrial action in October - the highest since 2011.

entries.title: Former seat of pro-slavery Confederacy removes last statue
entries.description: A descendant of the rebel general said it was "a tough day", but a black Richmond resident said it was "nice".

entries.title: Peru protests: Roads and airport blocked in anger at new president
entries.description: At least seven people have died in clashes with police since ex-President Castillo was ousted.

entries.title: Delays to special needs help 'acute concern' - Ofsted
entries.description: Children in England are facing long delays in assessments, the regulator says.

entries.title: Children's icy lake deaths rock Kingshurst community
entries.description: As three boys die after plunging into a frozen lake near Solihull, tales of community spirit emerge.

entries.title: Bruck syndrome: 'Giving birth was the biggest fear of my life’
entries.description: Hira Ahmad became the first woman in the world with Bruck syndrome to give birth to a baby.

entries.title: Mick Lynch: The union firebrand accused of stealing Christmas
entries.description: As rail workers strike, the influential role of Mick Lynch has become a matter of national interest.

entries.title: Liverpool school abuse: We are the forgotten boys, survivors say
entries.description: Merseyside Police will review its original investigation following information supplied by the BBC.

entries.title: Excommunicated: The women fighting to be priests
entries.description: The Vatican has never allowed women to be ordained as priests, but there's a growing movement to overturn this ban.

entries.title: 100,000 babies to have genetic code mapped
entries.description: The whole genome sequencing project in England will screen for around 200 rare genetic conditions in newborns.

entries.title: Wieambilla: Six dead in shooting at remote Australian property
entries.description: Three suspects have been shot dead after the killings of two police officers and a man, authorities say.

entries.title: K-pop star Jin from BTS begins military service
entries.description: What can Jin from BTS expect from his time in the South Korean army?

entries.title: Why Taiwanese are among Ukraine's foreign fighters
entries.description: A small number of people, who see parallels with their island's situation, have travelled to fight.

entries.title: How many have died in school shootings since Sandy Hook?
entries.description: A decade ago, a gunman opened fire at Sandy Hook Elementary in Connecticut, killing 26.

entries.title: Newspaper headlines: Strikes, ice tragedy, and Harry and Meghan latest
entries.description: Many of the front pages carry the story of the deaths of three boys in Solihull, as well as plans to use taxis as ambulances during strikes.
